column3: Main GUPRI (i.e. PID) under which all terms are defined. Preference is to use PURLs or W3IDs as they provide permanent resolvable identifiers.

column1: Prefixes for controlled vocabularies, schema and ontologies

column4: Prefix for our controlled vocabulary since it is rather tedious to write long URLs all the time
Prefix for SKOS Onotlogy is which our base for defining SKOS based controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Provenance, Authoring and Versioning Onotlogy which properties such as version and createdOn we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary
Prefix for Dublin Core (Terms) Ontology which properties such as title, description, rights, source, etc. we will use to describe our controlled vocabulary as well to define its terms
I-ADOPT Ontology

A simple ontology which implements the Parameter Usage 
Vocabulary semantic model, as described at 
https://github.com/nvs-vocabs/P01.
Semantic Sensor Network Ontology
Prefix for "Quantity, Unit, Dimension and Type" schema that is used to model physical units.
Prefix for QUDT Vocabulary of Units which terms we will use to semantically define units of measurements for terms (i.e., variables) we are defining

column3: Home page of community creating vocabulary
An ORCID ID of the vocabulary creator
License under which the vocabulary is provided
Date when vocabulary was initially created
Automatic update when vocabulary is updated

column4: skos:definition@en
An analyte assay that measures the presence or amount of antibodies to a specified antigen.

column2: quantitative suspension multiplex assay to measure IgG subclasses and avidity to influenza virus antigens
column4: multiplex assay that measures the amount and avidity of a specific IgG subclass to several influenza virus antigens

A mass spectrometry assay where a sample mixture is first separated by liquid chromatography before being converted into ions which are characterized by using mass spectrometry based on their mass-to-charge ratio and relative abundance.
A proteomics profiling assay that detects proteins in a blood plasma specimen.
An RNA sequencing assay that determines an RNA sequence by analyzing the transcibed regions of the genome and or to quantitate transcript abundance.
A molecular assay that permits the simultaneous measurement of an array of proteins in a single, small volume sample.

A type of solid-phase multiplex assay that uses microbeads coated with recombinant or infinity purified antigens from a single allele for the detection and identification of an antibody that would bind and react to this antigen.

A cytometry assay in which an input cell population is put in solution, is passed by a laser, and optical sensors are used to detect scattering of the laser light and/or fluorescence of specific markers to count and characterize the particles in solution.
An analyte assay in which a series of beads coated with antibodies, antigens, or other small molecules are used to detect an analyte of interest.

column2: antibodies as biomarkers of vaccine protection

column4: A substance used as an indicator of a biological state.
A marked decrease in contrast enhancement that is not due to actual tumor shrinkage, but that may be due to immunotherapy.
The mechanism by which a pharmacologically active substance produces an effect on a living organism or in a biochemical system.

column2: biomarker links pre-vaccination response to vaccine response

column4: A microbial phenotype that is observed at the level of an individual cell. This is a high-level term whose primary purpose is to organize terms beneath it in the ontology, and we recommend that it not be used for direct annotation. Please consider using a more specific term to annotate each phenotype.
The functionality of a cell.
